bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 173 (Thursday, October 31, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. FOXX of North Carolina:H.R. 4956.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H8719]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

summary.text:
Finding Market-Based and Local Solutions to Ensure Access to Housing Act

This bill provides statutory authority for the White House Council on Eliminating Regulatory Barriers to Affordable Housing.

bill.title: Finding Market-Based and Local Solutions to Ensure Access to Housing Act

item.title: Finding Market-Based and Local Solutions to Ensure Access to Housing Act

To provide that the Executive order entitled "Establishing a White House Council on Eliminating Regulatory Barriers to Affordable Housing" shall have the force and effect of law, and for other purposes.
Finding Market-Based and Local Solutions to Ensure Access to Housing Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
